column4: anyone remember how to find out which kernel source is installed?
thanks
sejEFF: 2.6.10-5-386 is returned by uname -r
What distro are you running?
Thats the command to list the currently running kernel, not the kernel source necessarily
i'm trying to determine if the running kernel will support the latest nvidia drivers -
If its a stock ubuntu kernel, you should have no problem
And dpkg -l linux-kernel-headers will tell you the version of the kernel source code you have installed
: hoiw does one update the source ? i believe 2.5.9 is too old
: ubuntu 5.04
sudo apt-get install linux-kernel-headers
returned "latest version"
your kernel is what? And your headers are 2.5.xx?
kernel is 2.6.10-5
headers 2.5.99
Thats very weird, but you could try it out. You should install breezy, it is soooo much better :-)
painless way to install breezy?
Did you put /home on it's own partition during the install?
If you did, you could wipe everything except for /home and keep all of your settings with a fresh breezy install
how could i check? fdisk?
If you don't know, that means it is not
do: grep home /etc/fstab, sorry wrong name autocompleted
